public final class ESBoolean
extends ESPrimitive
Boolean primitive value

booleanValue()
Return the boolean value of this ESValue as defined in 9.2, throw an exception if not defined.
doubleValue()
Return the double value of this ESValue as defined in 9.3, throw an exception if not defined.
getTypeOf()
Return a code indicating the type of the object for the implementation of the "==" operator.
getTypeofString()
Return the name of the type of the object for the typeof operator
isBooleanValue()
returns true as we implement booleanValue without an evaluator.
makeBoolean(boolean)
Create a boolean primitive (either true or false) by returning the predefined (unique) true or false values
toDetailString()
Returns a detailed description of the value, intended for debugging.
toESBoolean()
Convert the value to an EcmaScript boolean (9.2) if possible
toESObject(Evaluator)
Return the EcmaScript object of this ESValue as definined in 9.9, throw an exception if not defined.
toJavaObject()
Return a Java object which is the object to pass to Java routines called by FESI.
toString()
